ygData.subject: Re: A Few Questions for Fellow Bards....
ygData.msgSnippet: I have heard this before. I have always played Jig while resting unless someone in the party is rally badly hurt... Lulen ... From: Tim and Mary Steed
ygData.messageBody:
I have heard this before. I have always played Jig while resting unless
someone in the party is rally badly hurt...

Lulen

----- Original Message -----
From: Tim and Mary Steed <timandmary@...>
To: <eqbards@onelist.com>
Sent: Thursday, June 17, 1999 02:06
Subject: Re: [eqbards] A Few Questions for Fellow Bards....


> From: "Tim and Mary Steed" <timandmary@...>
>
> WOW! Thanks for all the great replies, fellow Bards! If I were to reply
> individually, I'd surely fill up everyone's mailbox with a lot of "Thank
> you!" Notes, so I will just say thanks to everyone in this one message!
> THANKS!!! Some more info, and then another interesting question follows...
>
> Some more info: The "Lute of the Gypsy Princess" was looted off one of the
> Gypsies slain in Mistmoor. I can not say which since I was not there to do
> the slaying (smile). A group of mid to low 30's took her, and the person
who
> got the lute had travelled with me and msgd me to see if I wanted it. HECK
> YEA I wanted it, even if it DIDN'T have any "mystical powers". I still
think
> Verant SHOULD make some magic instruments, or perhaps bardic weapons that
> count as instruments, or instruments that have better effects than
standard
> ones, but I digress.
> Anyway, I paid 15 plat for the Lute, and even if it is useless, I shall
keep
> it to add to my collections. (smile) I tested it some more with the
Healing
> song and there's no difference in the numbers between it and a normal
Lute.
>
> Also, many thanks for the help finding Nostrolo the bard in S. Karana.
>
> Now, on to another question:
> I had a Paladin last night tell me after a battle to play the Jig O Vigor.
I
> wasn't sure why, since Stamina replenishes a heck of a lot faster than HP.
> And you know what he told me? The Jig O Vigor actually HELPS INCREASE THE
> RATE OF MANA RESTORATION! I thought at first that this was bull, and over
a
> few hours tried to test it with some mages. They all agreed that it did,
> indeed, help (however slightly) them restore mana! Has anyone else tried
> this? Does everyone else KNOW about this already and I am just now leaving
> the stoneage? Any input??
>
> Thank you all for the great discussion!
>
> Tim
> Tallonn Stringfellow - Bertox
>
>
> ------------------------------------------------------------------------
> Having difficulty getting "in synch" with list members?
> http://www.onelist.com
